abstract: The Rangers' slow start has highlighted their lack of team speed.
snippet: The Rangers' slow start has highlighted their lack of team speed.
lead_paragraph: After the Rangers lost their home opener, 4-2, to Toronto Thursday night, Coach John Tortorella said his team was mentally and physically lethargic. This may be true, but there could be another reason why they have spent so much of the early part of this season chasing the puck around the rink. Tortorella's team is hardly a collection of fleet skaters.

headline.main: Rangers' Early Season Troubles Show Lack of Speed
